Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in failing to analyze whether the applicant's experience constituted a well-founded fear of persecution or compelling reasons for refugee protection
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board found inconsistencies and lack of credibility in applicant's story
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Anecdotal and documentary evidence regarding past sexual assault and reporting
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 96 (Convention refugees), s. 97 (persons in need of protection), s. 108(4) (exceptions for compelling reasons)
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Past sexual assault and generalized violence in Haiti
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution; personalized risk
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of evidence of personalized risk or nexus to Convention grounds
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection proceeding followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Alleged failure to assess compelling reasons under s. 108(4)
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None found; court held Board adequately considered evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonable apprehension of persecution based on Convention grounds
Crimes.Application_Factor: Generalized violence not sufficient without individualized risk
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence of personalized risk or nexus to protected grounds
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroboration and inconsistent testimony
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant's credibility questioned due to inconsistencies
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged reasonableness of Board’s decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of reasoning by administrative tribunal
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to analyze compelling reasons argument

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee protection claim based on gender-based violence
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Insufficient to establish ongoing personalized risk
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Self-reported trauma, police report (if any), medical records
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Partially accepted; assault acknowledged but future risk not substantiated
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Incident accepted as true, but fear of recurrence not sufficiently supported
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Generalized risk in Haiti, not individualized
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Credibility and burden of proof in refugee hearings
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Refugee Protection Division hearing, followed by Federal Court review
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: State responsibility to protect individuals from harm
Crimes.Outcome: Refugee protection denied due to lack of personalized risk
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of harm due to past sexual assault and state inability to protect
Crimes.Legal_Framework: International human rights law, refugee law
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Demonstration of personalized risk and state failure to protect
Crimes.Institutional_Action: Board assessed state protection in Haiti
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Haitian authorities
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Generalized violence does not equate to individualized risk
Crimes.Individual_Status_or_Claim: Survivor of sexual assault seeking international protection
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Passive victim of crime, active reporter
Crimes.Temporal_Context: Ongoing conditions in Haiti at time of claim
Crimes.Personal_Data_Implicated: Gender, trauma history, identity as crime reporter
Crimes.Governing_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Inadequate state protection for victims of sexual violence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Personalized risk of harm not shared by the population at large
Crimes.Protection_Claim: Need for state protection against non-state actors
Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: State unable or unwilling to provide effective protection
Crimes.Targeted_Group: Women subjected to sexual violence in Haiti
Crimes.State_Protection_Adequacy: Found inadequate but risk remained generalized
Crimes.Legal_Basis: IRPA provisions on refugee and protection claims
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Membership in a particular social group (women in Haiti)
